Title


Description


Categories


Date






SQL Chatbot utilizing LLM Agents  [Langchain]


Created an LLM agent able to chat with sql databases utilizing postgres and Langchain.  A synthetic dataset was created to mimic real world e-commerce datasets.   Chatbot is able to read thorugh purchase data, article information, log data to answer questions and output csv files for the user to utilize.  [Langchain, Langgraph, Postgres, Streamlit, OpenAI] 


AI Agents


Dec 13, 2024




Rag Chatbot for International Students for official documentation on visa policies  [Langchain]


Utilizing chromadb and langchian to build a chatbot using retrieval augmented generation to answer questions related to visas for international students  where official information is retrieved from US Citizenship and Immigration Services.  [Langchain, LangGraph, Chromadb, Gradio, OpenAI] 


AI Agents


Dec 13, 2024




Travel Guide Chatbot [Langchain]


Build a travel guide chatbot using two approaches: 1. Custom Solution: Manually chain LLMs, fine-tuned models, and tool-calling for a tailored experience. 2. Modern Framework: Leverage LangChain for streamlined tool-calling and scalability.  [Langchain, Ollama, unsloth, finetune, LoRa, streamlit, OpenAI] 


AI Agents


Dec 13, 2024




Crisisfacts [Information Retrieval]


A submission for CrisisFACTS: an open data challenge for state-of-the-art temporal summarization technologies to support disaster-response managers’ use of online data sources during crisis events. Implemented a backend database with mongodb, self-made ackage to process data, and a frontend for better user experience.  [Docker, React js, MongoDB, Flask API, Information Retrieval] 


Information Retrieval


Oct 1, 2024




Reddit Analysis[AWS Sagemaker]


A project analyzing Reddit data and external sources like “Dear Abby” newspaper columns to explore patterns in how people seek advice and the responses they receive, uncovering insights into advice-seeking behavior and interpersonal reactions.  [AWS, Sagemaker, SparkNLP, RandomForest] 


Visualization


Aug 12, 2024




Price Prediction from Images with CNN framework  [Pytorch]


Building a CNN neural network framework from scratch with pytorch to predict the price of products sold on amazon through thumbnail images.  Further conducting saliency analysis and class activation map analysis to find what features the model looks at to predict price.  [Pytorch] 


Deep Learning


May 12, 2024




Building a Neural Network from Scratch with Numpy


Build a simple neural network entirely from scratch to develop a clear and detailed understanding of how backpropagation works. By implementing the process step by step, you’ll gain insights into the underlying mechanics of gradient computation, weight updates, and how the network learns from data.  [Numpy] 


DeepLearning


May 12, 2024




Toxic Comment Classification


Developed a model to classify toxic comments from social media platforms using an LSTM-based neural network implemented with Keras, leveraging deep learning to analyze and detect harmful content.  [Keras, LSTM] 


DeepLearning


Jan 1, 2024

title: JaeHo Bahng
text: Growing up as a third-culture kid, I moved every 2–3 years, living in Hong Kong, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, China, and Bangladesh. Attending international schools shaped my bilingual proficiency in English and Korean and taught me to embrace diversity with a global perspective. After 14 years abroad, I returned to Korea, earning a degree in economics from Sogang University. I then worked as a data analyst at an online fashion retail platform for four years. Currently, I’m pursuing a master’s in Data Science and Analytics at Georgetown University while working as a data analyst at Tractor Supply Company.

title: JaeHo Bahng
text:
About Me

Led projects in pricing strategy, inventory management, sales optimization, customer retention, and P&L analysis, leveraging SQL, Power BI, and Tableau for impactful insights and decision-making.
Expertise in predictive modeling, A/B testing, deep learning, LLM fine-tuning, web scraping custom Python packages, and model deployment implementing CI/CD pipelines.

International Background Growing up as a third-culture kid, I moved every 2–3 years, living in Hong Kong, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia, China, and Bangladesh. Attending international schools shaped my bilingual proficiency in English and Korean and taught me to embrace diversity with a global perspective. After 14 years abroad, I returned to Korea, earning a degree in economics from Sogang University. I then worked as a data analyst at an online fashion retail platform for four years. Currently, I’m pursuing a master’s in Data Science and Analytics at Georgetown University while working as a data analyst at Tractor Supply Company.
